page.title: 06 CHURCHES IN FOLKESTONE
page.content: There are twenty-one churches in Folkestone. Half have been built in this century and only eight churches appear to be more than two hundred years old. There are ten {Anglican} churches, three {Catholic} and three {Baptist},two {Methodist},and one each of {United Reformed},{Evangelical} and {Christian Science}. They offer a total of 92 services per week, the Catholic churches providing 31. The most interesting church is St. Eanswythes which was founded in 1138 and is dedicated to a local girl, a granddaughter of King Ethelbert, who developed the first convent in England in 630. It is very beautiful in architecture and decoration and has a stained glass window in memory of William Harvey. There are also two Garrison churches and one Mariners' church which overlooks the harbour.
